content: This one defines the direct sum of a collection of matroids. It depends on #15060, which just adds a few obviously missing lemmas to Matroid/Map.
The dependencies are all merged here now, so this should be ready to look at.

I've kicked this on the queue, because I think it LGTM and is nice and self-contained. The category theorist in me is wondering whether there should be some universal properties of these constructions... but I don't know how much sense that makes in matroid world... would that be stuff for a follow-up? Do you have anything planned in that direction?
I don’t, per se. But it is possible - there are categories of ‘weak maps’ and ’strong maps’ between matroids, and these will interact reasonably with direct sums.
You can find some details here. I don’t know much about this, though. Maps in matroid theory aren’t as important as they are in algebra.
Ok, that's totally fine. Then please ignore my comment
